messages.message: The notion that the initial field name becomes the initial prompt makes you almost certainly have to go back and edit every field you add. Creating multiple fields at once is helpful but we might as well enable adding the field name and the prompt at the same time. If I add 5 fields to start with then it almost certainly requires me to go back into each of those created fields and update the field name to something more concise

why is this the case @Travis? I think the reasoning/current process is that for fields that are simple basic extractions (like extracting ‘employee name’) there shouldn’t need to be a difference between the name and the prompt
but I do agree that this is the case for reasoning based prompts or ones that require more complex extractions (like multipage tables etc) and isn’t ideal
"extract as table" wowwweeeee
Are prompts generally that simple?
they should be
or like, idk, that should be the common case
though in practice it does not seem like that is the common case...
Currently I’m trying to extract individual rows from a data table and am resorting to prompts like “get second row as JSON object”
it isn’t a complicated prompt, but it certainly isn’t what I want the field to be named

I think the nicest way to do this, and something I’ve suggested in the past would be having the model summarize the prompt to get the name but not sure how much of a priority that specifically is haha
the fields dropdown does ask you to "enter field names" and not prompts
I think we add “field name / prompt” input boxes. If the prompt is left empty then the field name value becomes the prompt.
the UX of that will take a little massaging to convey how it works but it can alleviate having to go back and rename all the fields

alternatively it could be we take field names as input and create the prompt for the user (I actually think this is better for the user since we should try and abstract away the difficulties of prompt writing where possible) but this is also much more difficult.
would that mean we query the LLM to name the field for us as well?

btw we already have the capability of naming a field based on a prompt in ibllm

this was included in the initial AI Hub launch for complex prompts, but this is no longer a feature in the current AI Hub Build

cc @Kathy Wu

it seems that there are several cases here
1. sometimes you want to select multiple field suggestions and create a field for each of them
2. sometimes you want to create multiple simple fields
    a. ie in this case, you do not care about writing a prompt separate from the field name
3. sometimes you want to create a field with a longer prompt
    a. in this case, you do not care about creating multiple fields
is this an accurate summary?
Just 2 and 3 really.

yep this thread just covers 2 and 3

however, we’ve also received feedback requesting 1 in the past - which is why we have the current UI
though when making longer prompts I still would like to make multiple at a time.
1 is a good idea, but I wasn’t referring to that functionality in my feedback.
Thanks for the feedback and discussion. Design will likely revisit the field creation experience to make improvements.
thanks @alagu ! One other thing I’ve thought about is make a more dedicated field edit view to avoid cramming so many options into the small column on the right.
There is a dedicated field edit view? Maybe we can follow up to unpack your feedback when we revisit the design.
Serena also created a ticket (https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-935) to track this! @alagu I added a "design-needed" label so we can filter for feedback that requires design
